title: Lincoln Boyhood National Memorial: Visitor Centers
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Places To Go     Visitor Centers               Visitor Centers          Memorial Visitor Center The Memorial Visitor Center is a good place to begin your visit, pick up a park brochure, map and trail guides. Watch a 15-minute orientation film which tells the story of Abraham Lincoln's youth. The film is shown on the half hour, from 8:00 a.m. to a half hour before closing. The program is close-captioned. Visit the park museum which contains artifacts and exhibits that portray the life of Abraham Lincoln. Learn about his family, boyhood, and frontier life in Indiana.  Â       Living Historical Farm The Living Historical Farm is a working pioneer homestead with a log cabin, outbuildings, split rail fences, livestock, gardens and crop fields. Rangers dressed in period clothing perform a variety of activities typical of daily life in the 1820s. The farm is staffed from mid-April through September. Visitors are invited to visit and browse around the farm site throughout the year.
